content.body: Andreu Botella (he/they): Ugh, indeed, the sidebar's background color is manually specified with the assumption of light mode. I'll fix.
content.formatted_body: Andreu Botella (he/they): Ugh, indeed, the sidebar's background color is manually specified with the assumption of light mode. I'll fix.

content.body: Jake Archibald: have you ever seen service workers create JSON responses? Trying to figure out browser interest for https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/1389
content.formatted_body: Jake Archibald: have you ever seen service workers create JSON responses? Trying to figure out browser interest for https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/1389

content.body:
annevk: I am I correct in thinking that according to the mime spec, the following mime types should parse like this?
- `text/html;in]valid=asd` -> `text/html`
- `text/html;in]valid=asd;foo=bar` -> `text/html;foo=bar`
content.formatted_body:
annevk: I am I correct in thinking that according to the mime spec, the following mime types should parse like this?

  • text/html;in]valid=asd -> text/html
  • text/html;in]valid=asd;foo=bar -> text/html;foo=bar

content.body: All browser engines just accept this invalid name as valid.

Which brings me to this highly depressing page: https://wpt.fyi/results/mimesniff/mime-types?label=experimental&label=master&product=chrome&product=firefox&product=safari&aligned&q=mimesniff. Not even half of the tests pass in any browser
